subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
; “elder brother”
: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*(g/k)əw-n||elder brother; senior male relative}}; cognate with {{och-l|舅|maternal uncle}} ({{zh-ref|Benedict, 1972}}; STEDT).
: Alternatively, it may be related to {{cog|mkh-mmn|ကော|tr=kao|t=elder brother}}, with nominal suffix ''-n'' added ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
; “descendants; later”
: Perhaps from {{bor|zh|mkh-pro|*kuun||child}}; cognate with Min {{zh-l|*囝|son; child}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}) and with ancient Chu dialect {{och-l|觀|id=1|child; offspring}} ({{zh-ref|Ye, 2014}}); cf. also some rear meanings of the characters {{och-l|丱|young child}}, {{och-l|鯤|roe; fish egg}} and {{och-l|鰥|id=1|roe}} ([[ibid.]]). In modern Wu dialects the character {{och-l|官}} is used to mean "children" ([[ibid.]]).
; “many; numerous”
: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m-kul||twenty; all}}; cognate with {{och-l|群|herd; all}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; STEDT).

{{etystub|zh}} {{attn|zh|should probably be split}}

subSections.text: {{zh-der|公昆弟|垂裕後昆|寄生昆蟲|後昆|昆仲|昆吾|昆士蘭|昆夷|昆季|昆布|昆弟|昆弟之好|昆明|昆明池|昆明湖|昆池劫灰|昆玉|昆蟲|昆蟲學|昆蟲綱|昆裔|昆邪|昆陽|玉昆金友|賢昆仲|賢昆玉|金友玉昆}}

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=日04}}

# A [[swarm]] of or an organism that swarms (e.g. bugs), an organism that forms in large groups (e.g. [[kombu]])
# elder [[brother]]
# [[descendants]], great-great-great-great grandchild

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Hanja
subSections.text:
{{ko-hanja|hangeul=[[곤]], [[혼]]|eumhun=|rv=gon, hon|mr=kon, hon|y=kon, hon}}

# ([[맏형]] 곤, ''mat-hyeong-''): the eldest [[brother]]

subSections.title: See also
subSections.text:
* {{l|ko|鵾}} ([[곤]], ''gon'') [[swan]], among the largest birds
* {{l|ko|猑}} ([[곤]], ''gon'') [[dog]], the big one
* {{l|ko|鯤}} ([[곤]], ''gon'') [[fish]], the largest, legendary creature
* {{l|ko|混}} ([[곤]], ''gon'') ''maybe'', [[Hun]]s or [[Hünen]] "giants"
